text: I just started playing Human Revolution the other day.  I'm enjoying it quite a bit, and after hearing all the great things about this game, I'll definitely have to try it sometime as well.
author: Demi Fiend

text:
Also, not sure if you know about this game, but check out its OST, it's really fantastic - Crusader: No Remorse. 
The song that plays in mission 6 is one of my favorite video game tracks of all time.
author: Happytreefriendsfan3

text: Glad to see this song finally posted. The whole Deus Ex OST deserves to be on here, it's really amazing.

text: The Synapse (Hong Kong Streets) is a pretty dope track as well.
author: CyberRonin

text: It's about time that you posted this, should have been in the first 10 tbh
author: Sato

text:
Just in case you're curious since you clearly like VGM a lot, here are some really obscure OSTs you might like that I noticed you haven't posted anything from yet:

- Sapphire Skies
- Alter Ego: Dreamwalker (Most of these aren't on Youtube, but they all are on the composer's bandcamp, Ken "coda" Snyder)
- Road Rash II
- 999's two sequals, Virtue's Last Reward and the new one, Zero Time Dilemma
- Metro 2033
- Organ Trail Director's Cut
- Also Super Widget, but IMO the only REALLY good song from that game is BGM #4, but there are some other good ones as well so you may end up disagreeing with me.


- Probably more I'm forgetting but that's enough for now

Hope you end up checking those out (and enjoy them of course!).
author: K.T.B.

text: +1 for Organ Trail. Ben Crossbones does a fantastic job on that soundtrack.

text: Being a big fan of this game and having finished Human Revolution last year, which I also thoroughly enjoyed, Mankind Divided is easily one of my most anticipated games of the year. The latest impressions make me think it will be a great one as well!

text: YES!!! Love this track. Deus Ex (Original) is my favourite game of all time. And this level was so good! The memories. I am going to be playing through Human Revolution soon in preparation for Mankind Divided!

text: Though I find it to be the weakest entry by far, I still have to say I enjoyed my time with Invisible War.
author: SupraDarky

text: @foolio1990 Yeah, I bought the Director's Cut, so no worries! I believe it is discounted if you own the original HR (which I also had at the time lol...).
author: GamingNobility

text: @SupraDarky I am surprised you share the same thoughts as I here! I actually don't think Invisible War was as bad as people thought it was. I think it was mostly because it was a console port that people got riled up about it. I did enjoy my time with the game, but it was obviously not as good as the original game.
author: GamingNobility
